en: Gaskell Warren and Marcel, a  youth who helped cook in the hotel

A photograph of Gaskell Warren and Marcel, a French youth who helped in the military kitchens. Civilians are often used in military kitchens alongside troops who perform "KP" or kitchen duty. KP may be used as a form of punishment for troops, but is often assigned out of necessity. The caption that Warren and Marcel worked in the Hotel may allude to the troops' stationing in hotels in France. Abandoned hotels were used as military housing and as functioning hospital units when necessary.
Era 8 - The Great Depression and World War II (1929-1945)
